agenda.description: ** REVISION ** HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Appropriations TIME & DATE: 8:00 AM, Monday, April 15, 2019 PLACE: E1.030 CHAIR: Rep. John Zerwas The House Appropriations Committee will meet to consider the following bills: HB 1401 Howard | et al. Relating to the use of money from the permanent fund for health-related programs to provide grants to nursing education programs. HB 1803 Longoria Relating to the comptroller's access to criminal history record information of wrongfully imprisoned persons. HB 3635 Turner, John Relating to financial assistance paid to the survivors of certain law enforcement officers, firefighters, and other public employees killed in the line of duty. HB 3908 Thierry Relating to the allocation of funds remaining in the B-On-Time student loan account following the abolition of that account. HB 4000 Toth Relating to a study conducted by the Legislative Budget Board on the impact of state educational mandates on school districts. HB 4153 Anchia Relating to the election of alternative annuity payments payable to surviving spouses and designated beneficiaries of persons wrongfully imprisoned. HB 4426 Frank Relating to authority of the Health and Human Services Commission to retain portion of appropriated funds to pay for implementation of certain health care programs under the Medicaid program. The committee will also consider pending business. Testimony may be limited to 3 minutes. ** See Committee Coordinator for previous versions ** of the schedule, if applicable. NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
